thread.title: Pink events during Breast Cancer Awareness Month - High School Sports
thread.title_full: Pink events during Breast Cancer Awareness Month - High School Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Pink events during Breast Cancer Awareness Month - High School Sports
text:
North Jersey Pink events in October:
Buy this photo Breast Cancer Awareness Pink Ribbon In memory of former Mayor Susan Spohn, members of the Palisades Park student council, girls basketball team and Italian National Honor Society are selling Making Strides ribbons for $1.
Also, about 75 Palisades Park students will participate in a walk Sunday at Overpeck Park.
The Palisades Park/Leonia football team is wearing pink socks, and the cheerleaders have pink shoelaces and hair bows. The girls soccer team has pink shoelaces and pink pre-wrap in their hair all month.
Friday Oct. 9, the West Milford cross-country teams ran in pink socks and raised money for breast cancer awareness in conjunction with Passaic Valley High School.
The West Milford field hockey program decorated pumpkins pink (naturally) that are being sold at the Play 4 the Cure games
The 5th Quarter Club at Lakeland has created a shirt for the Pink Out football game, Friday, Oct. 30. Pink ribbons have been painted on the athletic fields.
Paramus Catholic ’s football game Nov. 7 vs. St. Joseph will be a pink out. Shirts, socks and bags are being sold online.
The Teaneck cross-country teams ran at the Manhattan Invitational in pink socks, and the Teaneck girls tennis team is using pink balls at all home matches in October. Cheerleaders also have pink pompoms, socks and bows. The volleyball team will recognize Breast Cancer Awareness at it’s Senior Night game, Oct. 26.
On Monday, NV/Demarest and Passaic Valley field hockey teams will wear pink socks for breast cancer awareness month, and will accept donations the day of the event to be donated to "Play for the Cure."
At Park Ridge , the volleyball team wears pink warm-ups, pink shoelaces and uses a pink ball. The boys and girls soccer teams wear pink socks.
Rutherford had an organized Pink Out for it’s football game Oct. 2, and the boys and girls soccer teams are wearing pink warm-up shirts.
The Fair Lawn girls tennis team is playing home matches using pink balls, wearing socks for Breast Cancer Awareness month and also raising money for “Tennis For Life,” a program where breast cancer survivors play tennis as a form of rehabilitation and support.
Cresskill volleyball will run a Dig Pink volleyball match on Tuesday at 5:30 p.m. Money raised goes to breast cancer research.
Becton will have it’s pink out football game on Oct. 23. The NFL provided the school with a banner, pom-poms to give away and customized wall card template for signature donation cards.
The Northern Highlands volleyball team plans on wearing pink in support of breast cancer awareness month Friday vs. Ridgewood.
Pascack Valley girls soccer fund-raised at its home county game Oct. 11. It was in honor of one of its students, Zack Latteri, who passed away from leukemia. All proceeds will be donated to the Zack Latteri Fund.
The Ramsey field hockey team will host NV/Old Tappan on Tuesday in a “Play 4 the Cure” event.
River Dell will have its pink out football game Friday against Dwight Morrow. The school also has pink nets on its soccer goals.
At New Milford , the soccer teams, tennis team and volleyball team all are using pink balls at home games. The cheerleaders have pink pom-poms, shirts, bows and socks.
-- Staff report
